document.masterDocTitle: A revision of the genus Muricea Lamouroux, 1821 (Anthozoa, Octocorallia) in the eastern Pacific. Part II

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A revision of the genus Muricea Lamouroux, 1821 (Anthozoa, Octocorallia) in the eastern Pacific. Part II

subSubSection.paragraph: Holotype . SMNH 1121, alcohol preserved, locality unknown, Leg. Salmin 1873, Rijksmuseum, No. 64.

caption.paragraph: Figure 41. Muricea nariformis Aurivillius, 1931. SMNH 1121. A Colony B Detail of branches C-D Sclerites, light micrographs.
Figure 42. Muricea nariformis Aurivillius, 1931. SMNH 1121. A Calycular and coenenchymal sclerites B Axial sheath sclerites C Anthocodial sclerite.

subSubSection.paragraph: The species was described by Aurivillius (1931) based on specimens from an unknown locality in the southern Pacific. He described the species as new without comparing with any type material and remarked that the new species was similar to Muricea robusta ( Aurivillius 1931 ). The two species indeed have some similarity discussed below. Presently we do not have specimens matching this species.
